  'propanoate' or 'propionate' ion is
  C 2H 5COO âˆ’ (propanoic acid minus one
  hydrogen ion).

A 'propanoic' or 'propionic' compound is a salt or ester of propanoic acid. In
these compounds, propanoate is often written in shorthand, as
CH 3CH 2CO 2 or simply EtCO 2.

Propanoates should not be confused with propenoates (commonly known as
acrylates), the ions/salts/esters of propenoic acid (also known as 2-propenoic
acid or acrylic acid).
